title: Man opens fire on officers investigating fatal shooting
content:
BALTIMORE —
A man was arrested after shooting at police officers who were investigating a separate fatal shooting in Baltimore Sunday morning.
According to a press release, officers responded to reports of a shooting about 1:30 a.m. in the 900 block of Pennsylvania Avenue.
Officers found Diandre Barnes, 13, and a 21-year-old man with gunshot wounds. Diandre died of his injuries, the release said.
Just after 11:30 a.m., while canvassing the area of the initial shooting, officers encountered a man with two guns. The man opened fire on the officers and ran, officials said.
Officers returned fire but did not hit the gunman, the release said. The man surrendered on Fremont Avenue and is in police custody.
A department spokesperson said the fatal shooting and the officer-involved shooting incident are not connected.
